description:
Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer (Dublin, Hybrid)

The mission, should you choose to accept it, is to pioneer and scale GTreasury’s core data platform into the future. Do you want to work with a small, hardworking, and awesome development team, whom you will help to catch a whale on a fishing line and feed the village? If you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, and iterative environment this might be the right role for you!

At GTreasury, you’ll be a part of the makers, breakers, doers, and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. As an established FinTech leader in the SaaS treasury management space, our vision is to create the next-generation of technology tools for the global, corporate financial office.

We are seeking an innovative and forward-thinking Business Intelligence Engineer passionate about building a world-class platform through a world-class team. You will be a hands-on technical contributor, responsible for designing, delivering world-class, performant and scalable Business Intelligence (BI) reports by using modern reporting tools and your knowledge of SQL-based relational and non-relational data stores and queries.

About the Team:

Our vision at GTreasury is to enable customers with the clarity to act, and our BI and Data Engineering team plans to do just that as we embark on a journey to build a next generation data analytics platform. This is a highly specialized team of BI practitioners who will dream, design, craft, and operate a full stack solution that encompasses data pipelines, warehousing, and self-service analytics.

What You’ll Do:

Design and develop BI solutions:
Actively participate in the evaluation of future reporting tools, platforms, and designs
Work closely with data engineers, DBAs, and software engineers in the design and construction of data related deliverables including databases, data lakes, reports, and dashboards.
Work closely with business stakeholders, including product management, solutions engineers, and department heads, to understand their data needs and challenges. Then translate these requirements into technical designs, and building the infrastructure that allows users to access and interpret data effectively
Create analytical experiences:
Working with data warehouses, data marts, and understanding concepts like dimensional modeling
Create and manage interactive dashboards, reports, universes, extracts, and data visualizations to facilitate data exploration and analysis.

Design and implement data models that support efficient querying and reporting
Solution optimization:
Conduct testing and debugging of BI applications to ensure accuracy, reliability, and functionality

Improve existing data queries, ETL designs, database structures, and reports
Optimize BI solutions for performance, scalability, and usability, considering user requirements and feedback

Operational excellence:
Perform regular maintenance and updates to existing BI systems
o Maintain all work within the standards of our compliance policies, and operational policies
Document all work as appropriate
Identify and resolve issues within the BI platform, including monitoring report performance and implement appropriate corrective actions for improvements as needed

Who You Are:

A technologist with demonstrable experience in and around the Business Intelligence, reporting, database, and data lake solution space
You love to learn new technology, and have a solid base of existing experience with data lake and data warehouse platforms and technologies (such as: AWS Kinesis, Kafka, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, etc.)
You are a troubleshooter at heart; you can identify and solve for data-related performance and quality issues in high pressure situations
You can work as part of an international team
You thrive on creating innovative solutions
You love tackling challenges with creative ideas
You write stellar code that wows and performs

Essential Knowledge / Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or the equivalent in experience, with at least 7 years of experience designing and implementing data solutions and analytical platforms.
Proven ability to influence and mentor others within an agile team environment
Highly proficient with Microsoft SQL Server (platform and tools such as the profiler), its databases (schemas, indices), and T-SQL (stored procedures, views, CTEs)
Experience specific to Izenda is a plus

Experience in the financial industry is a plus

Expert knowledge and experience in the implementation and usage of modern BI technologies and self-service analytics (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Metabase, Lightdash, etc...), preferably as an embedded customer facing offering
Proficient with ETL / data movement approaches and tooling

Abilities Required:

· Leadership

Mentoring and growing others
A collaborator and influencer across teams and colleagues
A champion and agent of change to drive continuous improvement

Highly adept at identifying and seizing opportunities to advance the technology and product, leveraging vision and insight.
Highly analytical and data driven
Leverage your advanced analytical and problem-solving skills to navigate the intricacies of a sophisticated application and industry. Excel in both verbal and written communication, and effectively collaborate with teammates and stakeholders, both technical and non-technical
Exude a commitment to quality and a keen understanding of customer needs, ensuring that every solution meets the highest standards
Be a self-starter who can prioritize tasks and accomplish assignments independently, driving projects forward with minimal supervision
Demonstrate a quick learning capacity, staying updated with best practices and current technologies in relevant areas, and applying this knowledge proactively
Utilize your solid analysis and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve issues efficiently, ensuring smooth and reliable software performance
Communicate effectively and thrive as part of a cross-functional, global agile delivery team, contributing to collective success
Bring deep data engineering experiences in complex distributed systems, ensuring robust and scalable solutions
Showcase your expertise with data in the cloud, leveraging native platform and tooling capabilities to build and maintain cutting-edge BI/reporting solutions

What You Will Get:

A high impact, high visibility role at a growing SaaS company that values personal growth, accountability, and the concept of “good work”

This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to make a big impact, work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, and win as a team to scale a growing business

A culture of open collaboration and problem solving

An empowered role on the Engineering team, responsible for driving accurate financial result visibility

Great benefits, culture, and the ability to work remotely.

More About GTreasury:

GTreasury believes there is opportunity in complexity. We connect treasury and finance teams with industry-leading experts, technology solutions and untapped possibility. By simplifying complexity, teams can unleash their organization’s potential to gain strategic advantages and grow. GTreasury helps organizations reach that potential by connecting treasury and digital finance operations through a world-class SaaS treasury and risk management platform and integrated ecosystem where cash, debt, investments, and exposures are seamlessly managed within the office of the CFO. GTreasury delivers intelligent insights, while connecting financial value chains and extending workflows to third-party systems, exchanges, portals, and services. Headquartered in Chicago, with locations serving EMEA (Switzerland, London, Ireland) and APAC (Sydney and Manila), GTreasury’s global community includes more than 800 customers and 30+ industries reaching 160+ countries worldwide.

At GTreasury, we know that our people are what makes GTreasury great and we celebrate the unique perspectives and experiences that our diverse teams bring to the table. GTreasury is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or prospective candidates based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and we strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply!

If you're applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an email to hr@gtreasury.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

If you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, and iterative environment this might be the right role for you!


At GTreasury, you’ll be a part of the makers, breakers, doers, and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. As an established FinTech leader in the SaaS treasury management space, our vision is to create the next-generation of technology tools for the global, corporate financial office.


We are seeking an innovative and forward-thinking Business Intelligence Engineer passionate about building a world-class platform through a world-class team. You will be a hands-on technical contributor, responsible for designing, delivering world-class, performant and scalable Business Intelligence (BI) reports by using modern reporting tools and your knowledge of SQL-based relational and non-relational data stores and queries.


About the Team:


Our vision at GTreasury is to enable customers with the clarity to act, and our BI and Data Engineering team plans to do just that as we embark on a journey to build a next generation data analytics platform. This is a highly specialized team of BI practitioners who will dream, design, craft, and operate a full stack solution that encompasses data pipelines, warehousing, and self-service analytics.


What You’ll Do:


  • Design and develop BI solutions:
    • Actively participate in the evaluation of future reporting tools, platforms, and designs
    • Work closely with data engineers, DBAs, and software engineers in the design and construction of data related deliverables including databases, data lakes, reports, and dashboards.
    • Work closely with business stakeholders, including product management, solutions engineers, and department heads, to understand their data needs and challenges. Then translate these requirements into technical designs, and building the infrastructure that allows users to access and interpret data effectively
  • Create analytical experiences:
    • Working with data warehouses, data marts, and understanding concepts like dimensional modeling
    • Create and manage interactive dashboards, reports, universes, extracts, and data visualizations to facilitate data exploration and analysis.

    • Design and implement data models that support efficient querying and reporting
  • Solution optimization:
    • Conduct testing and debugging of BI applications to ensure accuracy, reliability, and functionality

    • Improve existing data queries, ETL designs, database structures, and reports
    • Optimize BI solutions for performance, scalability, and usability, considering user requirements and feedback
  • Operational excellence:
    • Perform regular maintenance and updates to existing BI systems
      o Maintain all work within the standards of our compliance policies, and operational policies
    • Document all work as appropriate
    • Identify and resolve issues within the BI platform, including monitoring report performance and implement appropriate corrective actions for improvements as needed

Who You Are:


  • A technologist with demonstrable experience in and around the Business Intelligence, reporting, database, and data lake solution space
  • You love to learn new technology, and have a solid base of existing experience with data lake and data warehouse platforms and technologies (such as: AWS Kinesis, Kafka, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, etc.)
  • You are a troubleshooter at heart; you can identify and solve for data-related performance and quality issues in high pressure situations
  • You can work as part of an international team
  • You thrive on creating innovative solutions
  • You love tackling challenges with creative ideas
  • You write stellar code that wows and performs

Essential Knowledge / Experience:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or the equivalent in experience, with at least 7 years of experience designing and implementing data solutions and analytical platforms.
  • Proven ability to influence and mentor others within an agile team environment
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft SQL Server (platform and tools such as the profiler), its databases (schemas, indices), and T-SQL (stored procedures, views, CTEs)
  • Experience specific to Izenda is a plus
  • Experience in the financial industry is a plus
  • Expert knowledge and experience in the implementation and usage of modern BI technologies and self-service analytics (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Metabase, Lightdash, etc...), preferably as an embedded customer facing offering
  • Proficient with ETL / data movement approaches and tooling

Abilities Required:


  • Leadership
  • Mentoring and growing others
  • A collaborator and influencer across teams and colleagues
  • A champion and agent of change to drive continuous improvement
  • Highly adept at identifying and seizing opportunities to advance the technology and product, leveraging vision and insight.
  • Highly analytical and data driven
  • Leverage your advanced analytical and problem-solving skills to navigate the intricacies of a sophisticated application and industry. Excel in both verbal and written communication, and effectively collaborate with teammates and stakeholders, both technical and non-technical
  • Exude a commitment to quality and a keen understanding of customer needs, ensuring that every solution meets the highest standards
  • Be a self-starter who can prioritize tasks and accomplish assignments independently, driving projects forward with minimal supervision
  • Demonstrate a quick learning capacity, staying updated with best practices and current technologies in relevant areas, and applying this knowledge proactively
  • Utilize your solid analysis and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve issues efficiently, ensuring smooth and reliable software performance
  • Communicate effectively and thrive as part of a cross-functional, global agile delivery team, contributing to collective success
  • Bring deep data engineering experiences in complex distributed systems, ensuring robust and scalable solutions
  • Showcase your expertise with data in the cloud, leveraging native platform and tooling capabilities to build and maintain cutting-edge BI/reporting solutions

What You Will Get:


  • A high impact, high visibility role at a growing SaaS company that values personal growth, accountability, and the concept of “good work”
  • This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to make a big impact, work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, and win as a team to scale a growing business
  • A culture of open collaboration and problem solving
  • An empowered role on the Engineering team, responsible for driving accurate financial result visibility
  • Great benefits, culture, and the ability to work remotely.

More About GTreasury:


GTreasury believes there is opportunity in complexity. We connect treasury and finance teams with industry-leading experts, technology solutions and untapped possibility. By simplifying complexity, teams can unleash their organization’s potential to gain strategic advantages and grow. GTreasury helps organizations reach that potential by connecting treasury and digital finance operations through a world-class SaaS treasury and risk management platform and integrated ecosystem where cash, debt, investments, and exposures are seamlessly managed within the office of the CFO. GTreasury delivers intelligent insights, while connecting financial value chains and extending workflows to third-party systems, exchanges, portals, and services. Headquartered in Chicago, with locations serving EMEA (Switzerland, London, Ireland) and APAC (Sydney and Manila), GTreasury’s global community includes more than 800 customers and 30+ industries reaching 160+ countries worldwide.


At GTreasury, we know that our people are what makes GTreasury great and we celebrate the unique perspectives and experiences that our diverse teams bring to the table. GTreasury is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or prospective candidates based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and we strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply!


If you're applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an email to hr@gtreasury.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Mediolanum International Funds Limited (MIFL) is a management company approved by the Central Bank of Ireland to manage UCITS & Non UCITS Funds as well as the Research & Development (R&D) and funds product innovation centre (MedLab®) for the Mediolanum Banking Group.



MIFL undertakes significant proprietary R&D and collaborates with selected international partners, leveraging on its open innovation platform and proprietary process (MedInSynC®), with a view towards developing in house solutions tailored to meet clients’ needs. We believe this ensures that we can deliver value adding investment products and services to our predominantly European retail client base. MIFL is also one of the pioneers for the protection of Intellectual Property in the funds industry and is very active in shaping evolving market best practice in this area.
description:
Employment Type Permanent
Location
Role Profile We have an excellent opportunity at Mediolanum to join our Analytics and AI team as a Data Analytics Engineer. The Analytics and AI team works under the Chief Data Office, which is responsible for driving the data strategy in the business, enabling our stakeholders to provide world class client performance in asset management.

As a Data Analytics Engineer in the team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data-driven solutions using a variety of technologies, with a strong focus on Power BI. This role requires deep expertise in data analytics, data warehousing, and business intelligence.

The successful candidate will enable the growth of our user base of BI tool users and consumers via our community of practice. You will transform complex data sets into compelling narratives and actionable insights, leveraging tools such as Power BI, Snowflake, Azure, and the Power Platform to support strategic decision-making and AI-driven innovation. A strong culture of execution and delivery is essential to succeed in this role championing our strategy of a data enabled organization in all aspects of our technologies and business processes.

You will be joining at an exciting time when we are enacting our AI strategy which includes AI , ML and BI as critical deliverables.
Duties •Design, develop, and maintain scalable data models and pipelines for analysis, reporting, and data visualization in Microsoft Power BI.
•Administer and manage the Power BI Service, including workspace configuration, access control, and deployment pipelines.
•Create advanced, interactive dashboards that are user-friendly and deliver actionable insights.
•Support the development of AI-powered applications using the Power Platform and Azure AI services.
•Integrate data from Snowflake, Azure Data Services, and other sources to support comprehensive reporting.
•Train and support staff in using modelled data and developing self-service dashboards and promote data literacy and empower teams to make data-driven decisions.
•Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions.
•Implement best practices for data storytelling and visualization, staying current with emerging trends and technologies.
•Ensure compliance with data governance policies and standards.
Skills & Competencies •Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly.
•Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Qualifications & Experience •Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
•5+ years of professional experience in data analytics.
•Extensive experience with Power BI, including knowledge of DAX, M (Power Query), and Power BI Service.
•Experience managing Power BI workspaces and deployment pipelines.
•Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python for data analysis and automation.
•Experience with Snowflake for data warehousing and Azure for cloud-based data solutions.
•Familiarity with the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents or Copilot Agents) and its integration with Azure AI tools.
•Demonstrated experience delivering analytics solutions across business domains such as finance, marketing, sales, product, or customer success.
Applications Close Date

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Since our founding in 1998, Google has grown by leaps and bounds. Starting from two computer science students in a university dorm room, we now have thousands of employees and offices around the world. These Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe.

It starts with how we work together. We’re building a company where people of different views, backgrounds and experiences can do their best work and show up for one another. A place where every Googler feels like they belong.

Since our founding in 1998, Google has grown by leaps and bounds. Starting from two computer science students in a university dorm room, we now have over a hundred thousand employees and over one hundred offices around the world. These Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. So whether you want to be a part of developing innovative technology, campaigns, products or partnerships, your work here is a chance to accomplish things that matter. To learn more about our job opportunities, teams, offices, benefits and workplace culture, visit careers.google.com.
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Tel Aviv, Israel; Dublin, Ireland.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience in a sales role in the enterprise software or cloud space.
Experience in selling Business Intelligence (BI) and Software as a Service (SaaS) technologies.
Ability to communicate in Hebrew and English fluently in order to communicate with our customers and internal stakeholders.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience selling Business intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Databricks, Snowflake, Qlik.
Experience supporting long-term executive relationships, and developing territories/accounts from scratch, while ensuring customer success, adoption and expansion.
Experience selling usage-based SaaS solutions focusing on Data Analytics, Big Data, AI/ML.
Experience in retail or financial services.
Experience prioritizing, planning, and organizing business activity within complex business-cycles, including qualifying accounts and leveraging partner ecosystems.
About the job
As a member of the Google Cloud team, you inspire leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like Google Workspace, Search, and Chrome. You advocate for the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. Your guiding light is doing what’s right for the customer, you will meet customers exactly where they are at and provide them the best solutions for innovation. Using your passion for Google products, you help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Sales Specialist, you will help us grow our BI business by building and expanding relationships with new and existing customers. In this role, you will work with customers to deliver true business value, demonstrate product functionality, and provide a comprehensive overview of key business use cases. You will lead day-to-day relationships with cross-functional team members (e.g., Data Analytics Sales Specialists, Field Sales, Customer Engineering) and external customers, leading with empathy, while identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole to drive overall value for Google Cloud.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Build relationships with customers as a subject matter expert and trusted advisor, managing complex business-cycles, identifying solution use cases, and influencing long-term strategic direction of accounts.
Deliver against quota and achieve or exceed strategic business and growth goals while forecasting and reporting your territory’s business.
Work with Google accounts and cross-functional teams (e.g., Customer Engineering, Marketing, Customer Success, Product, Engineering, Channels) to develop go-to-market strategies, drive pipeline and business growth, close agreements, understand the needs of the customer, and provide excellent prospect and customer experience.
Develop and execute strategic account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across key industries; focus on building accounts.
Work with multiple customers and opportunities simultaneously, understanding each customer’s technology footprint and strategy, growth plans, business drivers, performer, and how they can transform their business using our technologies.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
We are Grant Thornton!

Grant Thornton is Ireland’s fastest growing professional services firm. We deliver solutions to all business challenges. Clients choose us because the breadth of financial and business services they need is available, delivered innovatively and always to the highest standards. At Grant Thornton we are committed to long term relationships. We are different. We are Grant Thornton.

The firm comprises over 1000 people operating from offices in Dublin, Belfast, Cork, Galway, Kildare, Limerick and Longford.

Global scale and agility:

As a member of Grant Thornton International, a $5bn global organisation of member firms with 50,000 people in over 130 countries, we have the scale to meet your changing needs, but with the insight and agility that helps you to stay one step ahead.

Privately owned, publicly listed and public sector clients come to us for our technical skills and industry capabilities but also for our different way of working. Our partners and teams invest the time to truly understand your business, giving real insight and a fresh perspective to keep you moving.

Whether a business has domestic or international aspirations, Grant Thornton can help you to unlock your potential for growth.

Experience something new

We offer you exposure, great clients, a rewarding career and also a chance to be you. To bring your whole self to work and have your unique talents and insights recognised and relied on. We reward your contributions with a comprehensive salary and benefits package and can offer you an inclusive and collaborative working environment, where you can thrive.

As an experienced hire, you'll have the opportunity to be a leader and also provide coaching and mentoring to help our people develop and grow. Although our services are across Audit, Tax and Advisory, we work within different industries and allow our people to showcase their expertise in these areas to advise our clients.
description:
IT Business Process Analyst

We are Grant Thornton. We go beyond business as usual, so you can too.

Grant Thornton Ireland (GT) has nearly 3,000 people in 9 offices across Ireland, The Isle of Man, Gibraltar, and Bermuda, with a presence in over 145 countries around the world, and a global network of over 68,000 people

At GT, we work as trusted advisors, bringing local knowledge and national expertise, with a global presence, to help businesses succeed – wherever they are located. We make business more personal by investing in building relationships and empowering our clients to make the right decisions for their organisation now and for the future. Whether that is working with the public sector to build thriving communities, with regulators and financial institutions to build trust, or with a diverse range of businesses to help them achieve their goals, Grant Thornton Ireland work hard to support clients to act on the issues that matter.

At GT Ireland we don’t just predict your future, we build it.

A Career at GT

Looking for a more fulfilling role in professional services? One where fresh thinking, collaboration and diversity are valued? At Grant Thornton we do things differently.

What does this mean for you?

A career in a more inclusive working environment, a more collaborative work culture, a more supported, flexible working role, more possibilities to grow and more opportunities to help shape the future for your clients. We respect and value your experience. And we want you to bring your authentic self to work and be at your best. It is how it should be.

Grow with us

At Grant Thornton, we care about our people and work hard to make you feel valued. If you are looking to deepen and develop your skills, knowledge, and experience throughout your career, then that is what you will get, and more.

The IT Business Process Analyst will help drive critical business decisions for IT leadership by providing insights using analytics and reporting using Power BI/Fabric and by helping to manage, automate, and streamline business processes, under the guidance of the Analytics Manager. In addition to technical skills, the analyst must have the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time well. A successful candidate will be naturally curious and willing to learn, have a strong technical education/background, strong experience with Microsoft Fabric and Power Platform (i.e. Power Automate and Power Apps), the ability to effectively communicate cross operationally, and possess a strong attention to detail.

Role summary:

Responsible for managing, automating, and streamlining business processes for IT using Microsoft Power Platform and supporting the Analytics Manager using Power BI.

The duties and responsibilities of the Business Process Analyst will be to manage and automate business processes, including providing feedback on how to update and improve them. They will support the Analytics Manager with analytics and reporting using Power BI. In general, the day-to-day activities of the Business Process Analyst may include the following:

A solid understanding of data sources, data organization and storage

Preparing reports and presenting these to management, demonstrating a solid understanding and interpretation of the data

Identifying and recommending ways to improve business processes for IT

Recommend new ways to use existing technology to automate business processes

Create business tools, processes and reports that provide insight into key process and data points using Microsoft Power Platform

Identify ways to improve processes to make them more streamlined and effective for the immediate team and for internal and external stakeholders

Support applications and workflows developed to ensure seamless processing and uninterrupted service

Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements

Continue to learn new technology as it comes out or is adopted by Grant Thornton to make recommendations on automating business processes

Qualifications and Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business/information systems or a related field

3-5 Years experience with Visualization Tools required – Power BI/Fabric preferred

3-5 Years experience in no/low code application development and workflow automation using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate and Power Apps)

Advanced Excel required – understanding of pivot tables, vlookups, and complex formulas

Excellent Organizational and Planning Skills

Advanced Communication Skills (various mediums (email, conversational and written)

Advanced Microsoft Suite Skills (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)

Microsoft O365 required – Teams, SharePoint

Azure DevOps experience a plus

Some financial knowledge/education desired

High Level of Attention to Detail

Critical thinking

Multi-Tasker

Takes initiative and able to work independently

Effective communicator with all levels of associates and management

Life at GT

Reward and benefits:

Our reward and benefits are designed to create an environment where our people can flourish. We are committed to building a culture where our people have access to the necessary benefits to help promote a healthy lifestyle and thrive.

Equity, diversity and inclusion
At Grant Thornton, we provide equitable opportunities for all our colleagues. We are a responsible, sustainable business where equity, diversity and inclusion (ED&I) is at the forefront of our workplace culture agenda, and today, we continue to build and develop on our existing ED&I structure and strategy to meet our workplace culture needs. People are at the heart of our business and teams built with varied backgrounds, racial differences, cultures, sexual orientations, religious orientations, ages, gender identities, abilities and family types present diverse viewpoints, which need to be heard and valued.

We are all at our best when we are able to be ourselves and we view integrity and authenticity as integral values to bring to our day-to-day work-life at the firm. We are excited to see the personality and perspectives you will bring to our team because we know we will all benefit from them. Diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision-making, improves the quality of our delivery, and helps us to meet the needs of our clients. Our firm is built on people and their ideas, so we want to hear all the new perspectives and fresh thinking you have to offer. You form the bedrock of our firm’s best-practice principles and we will champion you as leaders from day one.

Recognition:

We want to create a culture of recognition and celebrating success, by saying thank you to people who surpass our expectations and recognising the right values and behaviours. Our Shout Out recognition scheme is our way of highlighting and promoting achievements. Whether you simply want to say thank you, celebrate a special occasion or give an award for doing something exceptional, you can do all of this and more through the scheme.

#LI-KS1

  • Support applications and workflows developed to ensure seamless processing and uninterrupted service
  • Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements
  • Continue to learn new technology as it comes out or is adopted by Grant Thornton to make recommendations on automating business processes
Qualifications and Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business/information systems or a related field
  • 3-5 Years experience with Visualization Tools required – Power BI/Fabric preferred
  • 3-5 Years experience in no/low code application development and workflow automation using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate and Power Apps)
  • Advanced Excel required – understanding of pivot tables, vlookups, and complex formulas
  • Excellent Organizational and Planning Skills
  • Advanced Communication Skills (various mediums (email, conversational and written)
  • Advanced Microsoft Suite Skills (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Microsoft O365 required – Teams, SharePoint
  • Azure DevOps experience a plus
  • Some financial knowledge/education desired
  • High Level of Attention to Detail
  • Critical thinking
  • Multi-Tasker
  • Takes initiative and able to work independently
  • Effective communicator with all levels of associates and management
Life at GT
Reward and benefits:
Our reward and benefits are designed to create an environment where our people can flourish. We are committed to building a culture where our people have access to the necessary benefits to help promote a healthy lifestyle and thrive.
Equity, diversity and inclusion
At Grant Thornton, we provide equitable opportunities for all our colleagues. We are a responsible, sustainable business where equity, diversity and inclusion (ED&I) is at the forefront of our workplace culture agenda, and today, we continue to build and develop on our existing ED&I structure and strategy to meet our workplace culture needs. People are at the heart of our business and teams built with varied backgrounds, racial differences, cultures, sexual orientations, religious orientations, ages, gender identities, abilities and family types present diverse viewpoints, which need to be heard and valued.
We are all at our best when we are able to be ourselves and we view integrity and authenticity as integral values to bring to our day-to-day work-life at the firm. We are excited to see the personality and perspectives you will bring to our team because we know we will all benefit from them. Diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision-making, improves the quality of our delivery, and helps us to meet the needs of our clients. Our firm is built on people and their ideas, so we want to hear all the new perspectives and fresh thinking you have to offer. You form the bedrock of our firm’s best-practice principles and we will champion you as leaders from day one.
Recognition:
We want to create a culture of recognition and celebrating success, by saying thank you to people who surpass our expectations and recognising the right values and behaviours. Our Shout Out recognition scheme is our way of highlighting and promoting achievements. Whether you simply want to say thank you, celebrate a special occasion or give an award for doing something exceptional, you can do all of this and more through the scheme.
#LI-KS1

description:
HR Data Analyst

This role focuses on data management and analysis in support of Headcount (HC) and position operations. Working closely with corporate and local stakeholders, the position will play a key role in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and timely reporting. The role also supports the Lead in data-related activities such as HC planning, data change processes, and HR expense tracking.

Organization Description

WuXi Biologics is a premier provider of biologics services (from discovery to commercialization) with global customers in the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industries. We´re one of the world's top three contract development and manufacturing companies for biopharmaceuticals, we provide our clients with a world-leading open access technology platform. We enable our clients to research, develop and manufacture drugs from the concept phase to commercial manufacturing. Our mission is to accelerate and transform discovery, development, and manufacturing in the rapidly growing field of biologics to benefit patients worldwide.

Department Description

As HR Data Analyst, you will be joining an organization where people of all backgrounds and experiences are respected, and where we work together focused on changing lives. In this role you will be reporting to the HR Operations Lead.

Your Responsibilities:

· Maintain and manage HC/position data in alignment with internal governance and data management standard.

· Support the Lead in daily HC and position data tracking, including planning, control, and data validation.

· Perform data updates and changes in the HR system for various scenarios (e.g. job title updates, data corrections, reorganizations)

· Generate and analyze regular and ad-hoc reports to support business and HR decision-making

· Collaborate with corporate and regional HR teams to continuously enhance data accuracy and reporting quality

· Participate in data-driven projects related to HC and position management

· Assist the Lead in analyzing HR expense budgets, including actual vs. budget comparisons and trend analysis

· Handle other data-related tasks as assigned by the Lead

Your Profile

Education

· Bachelor’s degree and above

Technical Competencies

· Proficient in excel, etc. Microsoft skills and good at Power BI is a plus

· Good at information integration

· Good command of both written and spoken English

Knowledge/Experience

· HR and process improvement experience is a plus

· Data analytics experience is a plus

Behavioural Competencies

· Proactive, detail-oriented, result-focused

· Logical thinking and quick leaner

· Respect rules

· Good communication and interpersonal skills

As we extend our global reach, we need colleagues interested in change, in challenge, and in building a new future together. Reach beyond yourself and discover your true potential!

If you have the ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and feel that the moment has come for you to be part of such an exciting journey towards accomplishing our mission - Any drug can be made, and any disease can be treated - don’t miss out on this opportunity to join us and reach beyond yourself and discover your true potential. Apply now!

Would you like to know more before you apply? Please visit us at https://www.wuxibiologicscareers.ie or contact us via talentacquisition@wuxibiologics.com WuXi Biologics is an equal opportunities employer.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Social Discovery Group is a global tech company uniting 60+ products with 500 million users globally, and a corporate venture studio SDG Lab. We solve the problem of loneliness, isolation, and disconnection transforming virtual intimacy into the new normal. Our portfolio includes online communication platforms focusing on AI, game mechanics, and video streaming. 

In 2024 the company was certified as a Great Place to Work in the US. SDG's international team of 1200 professionals and digital nomads works all over the world.
description:
(https://socialdiscoverygroup.com/about-us/) (https://socialdiscoverygroup.com/about-us)Social Discovery Group (https://socialdiscoverygroup.com/about-us) (SDG) is the 3rd largest social discovery company in the world, uniting 60+ brands with 500 million users. We solve the problems of loneliness, isolation, and disconnection by transforming virtual intimacy into the new normal. Our portfolio includes online communication platforms focusing on AI, game mechanics, and video streaming - Dating.com, DateMyAge, Cupid Media, Dil Mil, Kiseki, and others.

SDG invests in IT startups around the world. Our investments include Open AI, Patreon, Flo, Clubhouse, Woebot, Flure, Astry, Coursera, Academia.edu, and many others.

We bring together a team of like-minded people and IT professionals specializing in the creation and development of globally impactful social discovery products. Our international team of 1200 professionals and digital nomads works all over the world.

Our teams of digital nomads work remotely from Cyprus, Malta, the USA, Armenia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Montenegro, Poland, Latvia, Serbia, Spain, Portugal, UAE, Israel, Turkey, Thailand, Indonesia, Japan, Hong Kong, Australia and many other locations.

In August 2024, we achieved Great Place to Work US Certification™! This achievement reflects our core belief that a truly exceptional workplace is built on trust, pride, and camaraderie—not just great perks.

We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join one of our AI product teams - TheOne.AI.

TheOne is an AI-driven platform designed for authentic interaction and entertainment, helping to combat loneliness. It features a unique profile marketplace with detailed backstories, covering individuals of all ages, genders, and nationalities, each with their unique interests. AI bots behind these profiles offer a personalized communication experience, mimicking real human interactions so convincingly that the line between artificial and real fades away.

These bots can engage in conversations, send voice messages, and share photos and videos, creating a sense of genuine interaction. TheOne allows users to forget they're interacting with AI, offering a deep dive into the world of emotions and interpersonal relationships. It redefines virtual entertainment standards, making every interaction unique and rich, setting a new benchmark for AI developments.

Your main tasks will be:

Identifying growth opportunities: Assisting in the generation, prioritization, validation, and evaluation of hypotheses ("what would happen if...?") to improve key product metrics.
Conduct A/B tests: Evaluating the impact of changes using A/B tests and causal inference techniques.
Monitor key product metrics: Identifying the causes of anomalies and deviations in key metrics, and signaling potential issues with the product.
Maintain dashboards: Creating, updating and improving product dashboards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to integrate AI solutions into the overall product pipeline.

We expect from you:

Proficiency in Python, SQL: Strong coding skills in Python, experience with SQL.
Deep knowledge of statistics: Expertise in probability theory, statistics and A/B tests.
Understanding of product and marketing metrics: LTV, CSI, retention, conversions, etc.
Familiarity with BI tools: Superset, Grafana, Power BI, etc.
English level: B2+

Nice to have:

Understanding of ML: machine learning concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning.
Experience in unsupervised learning: clustering, anomaly detection, visualization.
Experience with data labeling: Experience with drafting instructions and assessing quality of data labeling (Toloka, MTurk).

What do we offer:

REMOTE OPPORTUNITY to work full time;
Vacation 28 calendar days per year;
7 wellness days per year (time off) that can be used to deal with household issues, to lie down and recover without taking sick leave;
Bonuses up to $5000 for recommending successful applicants for positions in the company;
Full payment for professional training, international conferences and meetings;
Corporate discount for English lessons;
Health benefits. According to the paychecks, if you are not eligible for corporate medical insurance, the company will compensate you with up to $ 1,000 gross per year per employee. This can be spent on self-purchase of health insurance or on doctor's fees for yourself and close relatives (spouse, children);
Workplace organization. The company provides all employees with an equipped workplace and all the necessary equipment (table, armchair, wifi, etc.) in our offices or co-working locations. In the other locations, the company provides reimbursement of workplace costs up to $ 1000 gross once every 3 years, according to the paychecks. This money can be spent on the rent of the co-working room, on equipping the working place at home (desk, chair, Internet, etc.) during those 3 years;
Internal gamified gratitude system: receive bonuses from colleagues and exchange them for time off, merch, team building activities, massage certificates, etc.

Sounds good? Join us now!

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Are you looking for a sector that is hiring, and want to join a large international and dynamic group that places its employees at the heart of its concerns? Then, join the Crédit Agricole Group!

By choosing to join us, you will become part of a large international group with 54 million customers, 12.1 million members, and 157,000 employees, 26% of whom are based internationally. We are certainly close to you, as we cover the entire French territory with 39 regional branches, two campuses in the Paris area, and a presence on all continents.

One of our characteristics, which is sometimes not well known, is our multi-brand and multi-business dimension. Our Group is made up of numerous companies, some of which you may already know: LCL, BforBank, Sofinco, Amundi...

Our areas of expertise are numerous: IT, real estate, publishing, savings and insurance management, specialized financial services, large clients, and of course, local banking. With over 140 professions, there are definitely opportunities for you: purchasing, insurance, accounting, real estate, IT, audit, sales, financing and investment, marketing and communication...

Why join us?
- To join a Group that will place you at the heart of its projects and give you the opportunity to shape your career. Each year, over 11,000 employees evolve into new positions and roles within the Group.
- For our international presence, the diversity of professions and missions.
- For our values and commitments: solidarity, gender diversity, inclusion of youth, innovation, green finance...
description:
Description du poste

Credit Agricole Credit Insurance (CACI) is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Risk Analyst to join our Risk Management team in Dublin.

The successful candidate will play a key role in contributing to the effective implementation of the risk management framework and internal control systems.

This role will support transversally the Chief Risk Officer, the Operational Risk Officer, and the Senior Risk Manager in managing operational, investment, and underwriting risks as outlined thereafter.

Risk Identification
• Comprehensive identification and assessment of risks in accordance with Solvency II and CAA standards.
• Contribute to issue risk opinions on significant business and operational developments

Risk Controlling
• Implementation of the risk management framework at the level of operational policies, processes, and procedures, according to CAA risk management standards.
• Maintenance of an effective and proportionate internal control framework for preventing, detecting operational incidents and/or excessive risk taking.
• Effective implementation of the Risk Appetite framework and control that the agreed tolerances are adhered to.
• Recommendations to the 1st line to strengthen the control environment.

Operational Incidents
• Ensure a fast and efficient response from the 1st line to operational incidents.
• Track and monitor progress on remediation actions.
• Report outstanding operational incidents to the management and governance bodies of CACI and to CAA Risk Management, as agreed with the Chief Risk Officer.

Risk Reporting
• Report on risk management activities to the management and governance bodies of CACI.
• Collect and report internal controls of CACI on both internal and outsourced activities to the management and governance bodies of CACI.
• Maintain and constantly improve the depth and relevance of the risk dashboard.
Critères de candidature
Poste avec management
Non
Niveau d'étude minimum
Bac + 3 / L3
Formation / Spécialisation
Bachelor degree or equivalent in audit/control/finance or its equivalent in terms of professional experience.
At minimum 3 years’ experience in the areas of control (risk, audit, permanent control) in insurance or banking.
Niveau d'expérience minimum
3 - 5 ans
Compétences recherchées
• Good knowledge of control management standards and best practices.
• Strong communication skills including the ability to interact effectively at all levels, both internally and externally.
• Analytical skills and ability to understand and resolve complex issues.
• Ability to adapt to and manage changes.
• Confidentiality, discretion.
• Passion for driving continuous improvements.• Master Microsoft Office packages (e.g. Excel, Word, PowerPoint);
• Ability to code is a plus
Langues
Proficient in English & French
Entreprise Crédit Agricole Assurances

Crédit Agricole Assurances est le 1er assureur en France et le 1er bancassureur en Europe. Le groupe propose une gamme de produits et services en épargne, retraite, santé, prévoyance et assurance des biens. Ils sont distribués par les banques du groupe Crédit Agricole en France et dans 9 autres pays dans le monde, par des conseillers en gestion patrimoniale et des agents généraux. Les compagnies de Crédit Agricole Assurances s'adressent aux particuliers, professionnels, agriculteurs et entreprises. A fin 2024, Crédit Agricole Assurances compte 6 700 collaborateurs et son chiffre d'affaires s'élève à 43,6 milliards d'euros (normes IFRS). Leader de l'assurance emprunteur en France et 3ème acteur européen du domaine, ainsi que 1er en France concernant la prévoyance décès, l'assurance obsèques et la dépendance, nous développons des solutions pour couvrir les risques liés au décès, à l'arrêt de travail et à la dépendance, auprès des jeunes, des familles et des séniors, des salariés et des professionnels, via des parcours multicanaux intégrés dans les process de nos partenaires : banques de détail et sociétés de financement spécialisées en France et Europe. Ce sont 150 collaborateurs, basés à Dublin et Milan, qui contribuent à cette activité. Convaincus que la Diversité est une source d'enrichissement pour tous, nous sommes engagés en faveur de l'inclusion. Nos postes sont ouverts à toutes et tous, quels que soient les handicaps ou les singularités de chacun.
